abstract_summ: We consider and compare various exit strategy building blocks and key measures to mitigate the current SARS-CoV-2 pandemic, some already proposed as well as improvements we suggest.The most effective building blocks are the ones that integrate several base strategies - they allow to release large portions of the population while still achieving diminishing viral spread.(3) If the strong mitigation precedes April 1st, then the growth of COVID-19 can be controlled and the ICU capacity could be adequate.Predicted ICU and non-ICU demand was compared with the peak in hospital bed use observed in April 2020.We estimate the growth in demand for ICU beds in Chicago during the emerging COVID-19 epidemic, using state-of-the-art computer simulations calibrated for the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
title_summ: Comparison of SARS-CoV-2 Exit Strategies Building BlocksWindow of Opportunity for Mitigation to Prevent Overflow of ICU capacity in Chicago by COVID-19Predicted Effects of Stopping COVID-19 Lockdown on Italian Hospital Demand
title_abstract_phrases: Comparison of SARS-CoV-2 Exit Strategies Building BlocksWe consider and compare various exit strategy building blocks and key measures to mitigate the current SARS-CoV-2 pandemic, some already proposed as well as improvements we suggest.Window of Opportunity for Mitigation to Prevent Overflow of ICU capacity in Chicago by COVID-19We estimate the growth in demand for ICU beds in Chicago during the emerging COVID-19 epidemic, using state-of-the-art computer simulations calibrated for the SARS-CoV-2 virus.(3) If the strong mitigation precedes April 1st, then the growth of COVID-19 can be controlled and the ICU capacity could be adequate.The most effective building blocks are the ones that integrate several base strategies - they allow to release large portions of the population while still achieving diminishing viral spread.The questions we address are these: (1) Will the ICU capacity in Chicago be exceeded, and if so by how much?
